channel.title: Windows Xp
channel.description: OK, I got a re-utilized laptop from a family member. And it had Windows Xp Professional Edition on it. And it didn't come with a reinstallation disc. And I've lost all mine. And then remembered I could use the I386 in the WINDOWS folder to install. So I did that, but it did a dual boot of two copies of Windows Xp. So I'm wondering if it's possible to do a clean install through WINNT32.

item.title: Windows Xp
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Well, that wasn’t the problem. I started downloading one after I made the post. I have 2 different versions of Windows on my external HD. But I lost the board to convert it to USB and a Power supply. I was just wanting to know if I could do a clean install from the I386 folder.

Read full topic

shit. true.

@Mopman wrote:

You don’t need Hirens… the Windows XP cd will format.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Xp
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

Uhh…
get a copy of Hiren’s BootCD… use DOS to format c:\ and reinstall windows with a disc (find it offline somewhere) or even just use Ubuntu, it’s much more stable than windows and virtually virus-free.

warez-bb has their registrations open again, so register and find an iso of windows or something.
hopefully you have a cd burner and some blank discs and know how to make a computer boot from a CD. If you don’t feel free to pm me… AFTER you have everything you need.

Read full topic

Ever heard of torrents? Use them.
